716594f-a.text:
(1)
23 to 3 Baxter Street (right), east side, south from Worth Street, to Park Row. Also shown (left) is Worth Street, south side, east from Baxter Street to Chatham Square. Also shown is a general view of the neighboring area, south from the State Building, at the N.W. corner of Worth and Baxter Streets, with the Brooklyn (right) and Manhattan (left)
Bridges in the distant background.
March 27, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A portion of the same, excluding the view of Worth Street. Also shown (right foreground) are two quadrilaterally shaped parks on the west side of
the street, in rear of the New York County Court House.
March 27, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
716594f-a.folder: Baxter Street & Worth Street, Manhattan, NY

(1)

716594f-b.folder: Baxter Street & Worth Street, Manhattan, NY

716593f-b.text:
Baxter Street, north from Worth to Franklin Streets, showing the rear of the New York State Office Building opposite the southestern corner of Columbus Park. Beyond same are buildings that will be demolished to provide a new site for the new Criminal Courts Building. These buildings and park stand upon the former Collect Pond, which after filling became known as the Five Points.
November 6, 1937.
716593f-b.folder: Baxter Street & Worth Street, Manhattan, NY

724831f-a.text:
Worth Street, at the S.W. corner of Baxter Street, showing a statue of Christopher Columbus at this location, as viewed southwestward towards the Municipal Building and across the low rear wing of
the new U.5. Court House.
About 1936
Gift of Michael Wishengrad, A.R.P.S.
724831f-a.folder: Worth Street & Baxter Street, Manhattan, NY

from Worth Street, showing the New
York State office Building.
P.L.Speer.
NO REPRODUCTION. September 19, 1939.
